CatDescriptText: Mrs. Betty McGill, 2463 Waring Court, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The people. The reason is that they are not choosing the right men for Congress."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty McGill wearing light colored collared blouse with short sleeves and ruffle, holding handbag, standing in front of brick wall
